channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A French Immersion Program in Provence Leads to a Good Life Lesson
item.description: After a painful break up, the author travels to Provence for a language immersion homestay and learns the value of facing up to mistakes.

item.title: Israeli Jets Pummel Hezbollah Targets in Southern Lebanon
item.description: The strike, which wounded dozens, showed that the militant group remains a force.

item.title: Israel Attacks Tent Camp at Gaza Hospital
item.description: People worked through smoke and darkness to extinguish fires and look through debris following the deadly attack on Deir al-Balah.

item.title: Russian Disinformation Targets U.S.-Backed Anti-Malaria Campaign
item.description: Scientists fighting the spread of infectious diseases on the continent have been targeted online by pro-Russian activists, part of an effort to spread...

item.title: Meteorologists Face Harassment and Death Threats Amid Hurricane Disinformation
item.description: Weather experts say the spiraling falsehoods, especially claims that the government is creating or controlling storms, have gotten out of hand.

item.title: European carmakers descend on Paris to showcase low-cost EVs
item.description: The show could mark a turning point for Europe’s automakers, which have struggled to produce cheap EVs.

item.title: ECB expected to lower interest rates once again as inflation in the eurozone fades
item.description: Inflation fell to 1.8% in September, the first time it has been below the ECB's target of 2% since 2021.

item.title: NASA Prepares Europa Clipper Launch to Study an Ocean Moon’s Habitability
item.description: The spacecraft will lift off Monday on a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket on a nearly six-year journey to Jupiter.

item.title: Italy’s deputy PM says Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares should be ‘ashamed and apologise’ for ‘mismanaging an historic Italian company’
item.description: Tensions between the government and Stellantis escalate amid a row over automobile production costs and incentives in Italy.

item.title: China shares rise on vague stimulus news while Europe’s luxury brands take a hit
item.description: Shares in mainland China rose as investors digested Beijing's Saturday briefing on stimulus measures—in which the finance minister said more was neede...

item.title: State of the Race: A Close Race Gets Closer
item.description: There’s no sign that a deluge of surveys from Republican-aligned firms is meaningfully affecting the polling averages.

item.title: Attention Kmart Shoppers: It’s Closing Time
item.description: As the last full-size Kmart in the continental United States prepares to close, shoppers reminisced about the store that once sold everything, everywh...

item.title: Another Trump Presidency Would Make China Great Again
item.description: Trump remains well outside a bipartisan consensus on competing with China.

item.title: Russian Oil Flows Through Western ‘Price Cap’ as Shadow Fleet Grows
item.description: A report shows how Russia has largely evaded sanctions aimed at limiting its revenue from oil sales.

item.title: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer vows to ‘rip out the bureaucracy that blocks investment’
item.description: Starmer will be hosting a London summit aimed at securing much-needed funds.
